intro: Tridax gaillardioides, commonly known as the hairy beggar's ticks, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Tridax gaillardioides is also known for its ability to spread rapidly, making it a common weed in many parts of the world.
